title: Magic IPsec tunnels
description: IPsec tunnels that connect Cloudflare with your endpoints

links.title: List IPsec tunnels
links.description: Lists IPsec tunnels associated with an account.

links.title: List IPsec tunnel details
links.description: Lists details for a specific IPsec tunnel.

links.title: Create IPsec tunnels
links.description: Creates new IPsec tunnels associated with an account. Use `?validate_only=true` as an optional query parameter to only run validation without persisting changes.
links.curl:
curl -X POST "https://api.cloudflare.com/client/v4/accounts/01a7362d577a6c3019a474fd6f485823/magic/ipsec_tunnels?validate_only=true" \
     -H "X-Auth-Email: user@example.com" \
     -H "X-Auth-Key: c2547eb745079dac9320b638f5e225cf483cc5cfdda41" \
     -H "Content-Type: application/json" \
     --data '{"ipsec_tunnels":[{"name":"IPsec_1","customer_endpoint":"203.0.113.1","cloudflare_endpoint":"203.0.113.1","interface_address":"192.0.2.0/31","description":"Tunnel for ISP X","psk":"O3bwKSjnaoCxDoUxjcq4Rk8ZKkezQUiy"}]}'

name.description: The name of the IPsec tunnel. The name cannot share a name with other tunnels.

customer_endpoint.description: The IP address assigned to the customer side of the IPsec tunnel

cloudflare_endpoint.description: The IP address assigned to the Cloudflare side of the IPsec tunnel

interface_address.description: A 31-bit prefix (/31 in CIDR notation) supporting two hosts, one for each side of the tunnel. Select the subnet from the following private IP space: 10.0.0.0–10.255.255.255, 172.16.0.0–172.31.255.255, 192.168.0.0–192.168.255.255.

description.description: An optional description forthe IPsec tunnel.

psk.description: A randomly generated or provided string for use in the IPsec tunnel

links.title: Generate Pre Shared Key (PSK) for IPsec tunnels
links.description: Generates a Pre Shared Key for a specific IPsec tunnel used in the IKE session. Use `?validate_only=true` as an optional query parameter to only run validation without persisting changes. After a PSK is generated, the PSK is immediately persisted to Cloudflare's edge and cannot be retrieved later. Note the PSK in a safe place.

links.title: Update IPsec Tunnel
links.description: Updates a specific IPsec tunnel associated with an account. Use `?validate_only=true` as an optional query parameter to only run validation without persisting changes.
links.curl:
curl -X PUT "https://api.cloudflare.com/client/v4/accounts/01a7362d577a6c3019a474fd6f485823/magic/ipsec_tunnels/01a7362d577a6c3019a474fd6f485823?validate_only=true" \
     -H "X-Auth-Email: user@example.com" \
     -H "X-Auth-Key: c2547eb745079dac9320b638f5e225cf483cc5cfdda41" \
     -H "Content-Type: application/json" \
     --data '{"name":"IPsec_1","customer_endpoint":"203.0.113.1","cloudflare_endpoint":"203.0.113.1","interface_address":"192.0.2.0/31","description":"Tunnel for ISP X","psk":"O3bwKSjnaoCxDoUxjcq4Rk8ZKkezQUiy"}'

name.description: The name of the IPsec tunnel. The name cannot share a name with other tunnels.

customer_endpoint.description: The IP address assigned to the customer side of the IPsec tunnel

cloudflare_endpoint.description: The IP address assigned to the Cloudflare side of the IPsec tunnel

interface_address.description: A 31-bit prefix (/31 in CIDR notation) supporting two hosts, one for each side of the tunnel. Select the subnet from the following private IP space: 10.0.0.0–10.255.255.255, 172.16.0.0–172.31.255.255, 192.168.0.0–192.168.255.255.

description.description: An optional description forthe IPsec tunnel.

psk.description: A randomly generated or provided string for use in the IPsec tunnel

links.title: Update multiple IPsec tunnels
links.description: Update multiple IPsec tunnels associated with an account. Use `?validate_only=true` as an optional query parameter to only run validation without persisting changes.
links.curl:
curl -X PUT "https://api.cloudflare.com/client/v4/accounts/01a7362d577a6c3019a474fd6f485823/magic/ipsec_tunnels?validate_only=true" \
     -H "X-Auth-Email: user@example.com" \
     -H "X-Auth-Key: c2547eb745079dac9320b638f5e225cf483cc5cfdda41" \
     -H "Content-Type: application/json" \
     --data '{"ipsec_tunnels":[{"id":"01a7362d577a6c3019a474fd6f485823","name":"IPsec_1","customer_endpoint":"203.0.113.1","cloudflare_endpoint":"203.0.113.1","interface_address":"192.0.2.0/31","description":"Tunnel for ISP X","psk":"O3bwKSjnaoCxDoUxjcq4Rk8ZKkezQUiy"}]}'

id.$comment: Must be present as a definition for URI Templating

name.description: The name of the IPsec tunnel. The name cannot share a name with other tunnels.

customer_endpoint.description: The IP address assigned to the customer side of the IPsec tunnel

cloudflare_endpoint.description: The IP address assigned to the Cloudflare side of the IPsec tunnel

interface_address.description: A 31-bit prefix (/31 in CIDR notation) supporting two hosts, one for each side of the tunnel. Select the subnet from the following private IP space: 10.0.0.0–10.255.255.255, 172.16.0.0–172.31.255.255, 192.168.0.0–192.168.255.255.

description.description: An optional description forthe IPsec tunnel.

psk.description: A randomly generated or provided string for use in the IPsec tunnel

links.title: Delete IPsec Tunnel
links.description: Disables and removes a specific static IPsec Tunnel associated with an account. Use `?validate_only=true` as an optional query parameter to only run validation without persisting changes.

created_on.description: The date and time the tunnel was created.

modified_on.description: The date and time the tunnel was last modified.

name.description: The name of the IPsec tunnel. The name cannot share a name with other tunnels.

customer_endpoint.description: The IP address assigned to the customer side of the IPsec tunnel

cloudflare_endpoint.description: The IP address assigned to the Cloudflare side of the IPsec tunnel

interface_address.description: A 31-bit prefix (/31 in CIDR notation) supporting two hosts, one for each side of the tunnel. Select the subnet from the following private IP space: 10.0.0.0–10.255.255.255, 172.16.0.0–172.31.255.255, 192.168.0.0–192.168.255.255.

description.description: An optional description forthe IPsec tunnel.

last_generated_on.description: The date and time the tunnel was last modified.

psk_metadata.description: The PSK metadata that includes when the PSK was generated.

enabled.description: Determines whether to run healthchecks for a tunnel.

target.description: The address used to run healthchecks for a tunnel. This field defaults to `customer_gre_endpoint address`.

type.description: The type of healthcheck to run, reply or request. The default value is `reply`.

allow_null_cipher.description: When `true`, the tunnel can use a null-cipher (`ENCR_NULL`) in the ESP tunnel (Phase 2).

object_definition.title: Magic IPsec tunnels
object_definition.description: IPsec tunnels that connect Cloudflare with your endpoints
